title: Friction Quartet and Christian Pincock
short: works by Pacific Northwest composers and John Adams
long:
San Francisco-based Friction Quartet will give world premiere performances of Treescape by Nathan Campbell, Friction by Roger Briggs, and a new work by John Teske. Also on the program are Zirma and Euphemia from String Quartet no. 1 “Invisible Cities” by Tom Baker and String Quartet no. 1 by John Adams.

Christian Pincock opens with solo works on trombone and computer using homemade controllers and software for live control of generated sounds and processing.
address:
Chapel Performance Space
4649 Sunnyside Ave N
Seattle, WA
